intro: Peltastes anomalus, commonly known as the anomalous peltastes, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, Peltastes anomalus is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
